data.message:
Looks like the question is off-topic and is about to be closed. So, I'll post it here if anyone can help:

I have an application where the user is building conditional expressions to do data manipulation.
Right now, the user has to write these conditions using a text editor. We want to switch to using a GUI where it's easier for the user to not mess up.
I'm trying to not build the GUI component myself, as this will take a lot of time. I was looking for a free open source component in either .NET, Python or JavaScript. For Desktop or web. It's an internal tool, so we don't have a budget for it, and we can build it in any language we know.
The expression is not a regular expression. It's a custom language that only works for a 3rd party application.
We're looking to be able to configure this component to explain the language's syntax/grammer.
If no tool is available, any recommendation on how to approach this, or examples for non-free, non-open source tools/components are very appreciated.
I have upvoted the question (the comments are ridiculous, since when did StackExchange stop being a good place for product/tool suggestions, I was like "give me a break").
Unless it's a duplicate of course and the other question answer works for you too.
Is it an internal or an external dsl?

You refer to a custom language so you're going to do a lot of customization to enforce your own keywords and rules also you could need to do some coding on the interface as well ... Sorry it seems easier to me to build the whole thing however if you are interested you can start an open source project with a generic interface and a way for programmers (users) to add predefined rules ... I'd be highly interested to help with such project.

Also these could help: 

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2545667/how-to-design-ui-for-building-conditional-expressions

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3871505/c-sharp-allow-user-to-enter-conditional-rules

Thanks Mohamed Meligy I agree but it seems that the rules now consider product/library recommendations off-topic.

There's a similar question which Professor Mina added but the answer for it is not really helpful. I'm looking for an actual component, not just how to design it.

Hady Ahmed It's an external DSL. Available here
